title: Unsafe re-entry ruins someone's race :(
reason: Drivers on the racing surface have the right-of-way. You must wait for a clear gap before re-entering.

title: Is this unsafe rejoin reportable?
reason: Hold your brakes and join safely when traffic has passed. Don't try to jump back into the race immediately

title: It was definitely a lunge but I’m unsure if it was illegal or not
ruling: The car ahead was already turning in
reason: and you had no significant overlap. At that point they have no obligation to leave you space.

title: I Am The White Acura That Get's Punted
reason: Failed to brake in time or leave sufficient gap under braking.

title: Is anyone to blame for this? was it preventable?
reason: Did not anticipate braking chain reaction in a pack and rear-ended the car ahead.

title: 2 Incidents on the same race both guys said I brake tested them
reason: Abrupt and unnecessary heavy braking with a car close behind to cause contact—classic brake check.

title: Who's at fault? Did he brake-check me or was I not paying attention?
reason: No reason to brake that hard on a straight; intentional slowdown to punish or cause collision.

title: Brake check?
reason: Full brake application instead of lift—dangerous and avoidable.

title: Where is the line between weaving/ breaking tow and blocking?
reason: More than one move per straight constitutes illegal blocking in most rulesets.

title: Would this count as blocking even though there is little movement ?
reason: Multiple direction changes to prevent overtake—reactionary weaving is blocking.

title: Great defending or blocking?
reason: Weaving excessively rather than one clean defensive move.

title: Which driver(s) would give penalties to for this T1 chaos?
reason: Typical lap 1 over-optimism with insufficient space—multiple drivers diving without overlap.

title: T1 pile up. Who's at fault?
reason: No single driver predominantly at fault; chain reaction from aggressive positioning on lap 1.

title: Who is at fault? This created a massive pileup
reason: Optimistic dive into T1 with low overlap triggered the chain—survive lap 1 first.

title: Is this a brake check or just a racing incident?

reason: Unsafe rejoin directly into the racing line—on-track drivers have priority.
